title.narrative: FORSA II

description.narrative:
Mercy Corps proposes “Fostering Resilience by Strengthening Abilities II”, a 6.5 million EUR gender responsive programme designed to increase access to education and employment for vulnerable youth from host and refugee communities over the next 3.5 years in two areas of Lebanon: Bekaa and South. Building on its successful training and job placement experience in Lebanon and on its extensive network of stakeholders, Mercy Corps will partner with private and public Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) institutes, private companies, local associations, incubators and online and offline job platforms to enable the participation of youth in targeted skills development aligning with market needs, to support access of young men and women to self-employment, and to improve job placement mechanisms in Lebanon in a sustainable manner, allowing vulnerable individuals to benefit from improved services beyond the duration of the programme.
To strengthen market based TVET provision to address the mismatch of skills to employment, and to strengthen platforms linking job-seekers with employment.

title.narrative: Annual Analytical report 2020
Immediate Outcome 3: Male and female youth have improved pathways to self-employment

description.narrative: Activities under this outcome are implemented by Mercy Corps’ local partner Al Majmoua.

title.narrative: Percentage of self-employment track participants with improved financial literacy

description.narrative: This indicator is measured through pre-and post-tests conducted for each different topic. Improved financial literacy is defined by an attendance rate of at least 80% and by improved knowledge in at least three topics out of five.

title.narrative: Percentage of self-employment trainees with increased self-employment capacity

description.narrative: This indicator will be measured at the endline phase; data for the endline will be collected in the second year of the programme.

comment.narrative: This indicator will be measured at the endline phase; data for the endline will be collected in the second year of the programme.

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 2: Percentage of programme participants reporting improved self-efficacy

description.narrative: Results relevant to the Intermediate Outcome Indicators 2 will be provided once endline surveys are conducted with the programme participants, which is six months after the end of the last activity.

title.narrative: Percentage of programme participants reporting improved self-efficacy

comment.narrative: Results relevant to the Intermediate Outcome Indicators 2 will be provided once endline surveys are conducted with the programme participants, which is six months after the end of the last activity. No endline was conducted during the reporting period, with the first round of endline surveys planned for January 2021.

title.narrative: Immediate Outcome 2: Job placement systems provide more equitable and sustainable access to jobs for targeted populations

title.narrative: Percentage of job platforms reporting an increase in the number of job placements over the past 6 months

description.narrative: This indicator will be measured through baseline and endline surveys with the platform representatives before and after the provision of the required support by Mercy Corps in Y2.

comment.narrative: This indicator will be measured through baseline and endline surveys with the platform representatives before and after the provision of the required support by Mercy Corps in Y2.

title.narrative: Percentage of freelance academy graduates with improved confidence to find freelance job opportunities Screen reader support enabled.

description.narrative: This indicator will be measured through baselines and endlines with graduates from the Freelance Academy: The first batch of trainees will be enrolled during the first quarter of Y2; therefore, the first endlines will be conducted in the second half of Y2.

title.narrative: Immediate Outcome 1: Youth from all targeted communities have improved market-driven skills as a result of better quality training systems
Immediate Outcome Indicator 1b: Percentage of programme participants with increased technical skills and knowledge after completing training (disaggregated by training programme)
Immediate Outcome Indicator 1b: Percentage of programme participants who graduate from the training

comment.narrative:
95 SPT + 65DT + 29 ALP
It should be noted that a total of 13 trainings were conducted vs. a target of 19 trainings planned for year one of the programme, which explains the low enrollment rate out of the set target for year one.
